functions.name: search
functions.desc: Search Wikipedia for an article with the given title, and get its content. If no such article is found, return similar article names.

msg.content: Who is the General Manager for each of the four teams that won the world series most recently?

<fragment>
Seager won the World Series Most Valuable Player Award and was the first player ever to win the award in two different leagues.[54] Manager Bruce Bochy won his fourth World Series championship, becoming the third manager ever to win World Series championships in both leagues, after Sparky Anderson and Tony LaRussa.[55]


Texas finished the postseason with a perfect 11–0 in road games. Marte's 20-game postseason hit streak ended, having walked three times and struck out once to end the World Series. Rangers pitcher Will Smith became the first player to win three consecutive World Series championships with three different franchises, having done so with the 2021 Atlanta Braves and the 2022 Houston Astros.[*citation needed*]



### Composite line score[edit]


2023 World Series (4–1): **Texas Rangers** beat Arizona Diamondbacks






</fragment>
<fragment>
| Radio announcers | Jon Sciambi, Jessica Mendoza, Eduardo Pérez, and Buster Olney (ESPN)Jesus Acosta, Alberto Ferreiro, Jose Napoles, and Luis Quiñones (TUDN)Eric Nadel and Matt Hicks (KRLD)Eleno Ornelas and José Guzmán (KAMM)Greg Schulte, Chris Garagiola, and Tom Candiotti (KMVP)Oscar Soria and Rodrigo López (KHOV) |
| ALCS | Texas Rangers over Houston Astros (4–3) |
| NLCS | Arizona Diamondbacks over Philadelphia Phillies (4–3) |
| World Series program |
| ![](image) |
| 

|  |  |  |
| --- | --- | --- |
| ← 2022 | **World Series** | 2024 → |

 |


The **2023 World Series** was the championship series of Major League Baseball's (MLB) 2023 season, and the 119th edition of the World Series. It was a best-of-seven playoff played between the American League (AL) champion Texas Rangers and the National League (NL) champion Arizona Diamondbacks. The series began on October 27 and ended on November 1 with Texas winning in five games. The Rangers won their first World Series title since their founding in 1961.


</fragment>
<fragment>
119th edition of Major League Baseball's championship series







| 2023 World Series |
| --- |
| ![](image) |
| 

|  Team (Wins) |  Manager(s) | Season |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Texas Rangers (4) | Bruce Bochy |  90–72 (.556), GB: 0 |
| Arizona Diamondbacks (1) | Torey Lovullo |  84–78 (.519), GB: 16 |


</fragment>
</document>

msg.content:
<document>
<title>2022 World Series</title>
<fragment>

Dave Dombrowski, the Phillies' president of baseball operations, made his fifth World Series appearance. Dombrowski is the first lead executive to make World Series appearances with four different teams, having done so with the Florida Marlins in 1997, Detroit Tigers in 2006 and 2012, and the Boston Red Sox in 2018.[25]



## Summary[edit]


*Houston won the series, 4–2.*

<document>
<title>2021 World Series</title>
<fragment>
| Radio announcers | Dan Shulman, Jessica Mendoza, Eduardo Pérez and Buster Olney (ESPN)Jesús Acostas, Alberto Ferreiro, José Luis Napoles and Luis Eduardo Quiñones (TUDN)Ben Ingram and Joe Simpson (WCNN)Daniel Cantú and Emanuel Zamarrón (WAOS)Robert Ford and Steve Sparks (KBME)Francisco Romero and Alex Treviño (KLAT) |
| ALCS | Houston Astros beat Boston Red Sox (4–2) |
| NLCS | Atlanta Braves beat Los Angeles Dodgers (4–2) |
| World Series program |
| ![TBD](image) |
| 

|  |  |  |
| --- | --- | --- |
| ← 2020 | **World Series** | 2022 → |

 |


The **2021 World Series** was the championship series of Major League Baseball's (MLB) 2021 season. The 117th World Series was a best-of-seven playoff between the National League (NL) champion Atlanta Braves and the American League (AL) champion Houston Astros. The series began on October 26 and concluded on November 2.


</fragment>
<fragment>

1. **^** "Umpires for the 2021 World Series announced" (Press release). New York: MLB Advanced Media, L.P. October 25, 2021. Retrieved November 15, 2021.
2. **^** Kelly, Matt (October 13, 2021). "Who gets home field in the World Series?". New York: MLB Advanced Media, L.P. Retrieved October 13, 2021.
3. ^ ***a*** ***b*** Simon, Andrew (October 24, 2021). "Top Astros-Braves playoff moments". New York: MLB Advanced Media, L.P. Retrieved October 24, 2021.
4. **^** Matt Young (October 26, 2021). "Why aren't Astros, Braves wearing World Series patch on jerseys?". *Houston Chronicle*. Houston: Hearst Newspapers. Retrieved October 31, 2021.
5. **^** Bradley, Mark (October 30, 2021). "Brian Snitker: The baseball lifer who's having the time of his life". *The Atlanta-Journal Constitution*. Atlanta: Cox Media Group. Retrieved October 31, 2021.
6. **^** Bowman, Mark (October 1, 2021). "Four and counting: Braves win NL East again". New York: MLB Advanced Media, L.P. Retrieved October 24, 2021.

</fragment>
<fragment>
117th edition of Major League Baseball's championship series

| --- | --- | --- |

| Houston Astros (2) | Dusty Baker |  95–67 (.586), GA: 5 |


</fragment>

18. **^** Workman, Mark (October 26, 2021). "Brian and Troy Snitker meet as father, son in 2021 World Series". Atlanta: MLB Advanced Media, L.P. Retrieved October 31, 2021.
19. **^** Aldridge, Donesha (October 26, 2021). "Who sang the national anthem in Game 1 of the World Series?". *WXIA-TV*. Atlanta: Tegna, Inc. Archived from the original on October 31, 2021. Retrieved October 26, 2021.
20. **^** "Craig Biggio, Andre Johnson do honors before World Series Game 1". *KHOU 11*. Houston: Tegna, Inc. October 26, 2021. Retrieved November 3, 2021.

msg.content:
Here are the General Managers for each of the four teams that won the World Series most recently:

1. **2023 World Series**: Texas Rangers
   - **General Manager**: Chris Young

2. **2022 World Series**: Houston Astros
   - **General Manager**: James Click

3. **2021 World Series**: Atlanta Braves
   - **General Manager**: Alex Anthopoulos

4. **2020 World Series**: Los Angeles Dodgers
   - **General Manager**: Brandon Gomes

Here are the General Managers for each of the four teams that won the World Series most recently:

1. **2023 World Series**: Texas Rangers
   - **General Manager**: Chris Young

2. **2022 World Series**: Houston Astros
   - **General Manager**: James Click

3. **2021 World Series**: Atlanta Braves
   - **General Manager**: Alex Anthopoulos

4. **2020 World Series**: Los Angeles Dodgers
   - **General Manager**: Brandon Gomes
